result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephanie M Slavik appeared by video from Mendota.  Attorney Robert Buckett appeared by video for Stephanie M Slavik. Court reviews case history. State advises nothing further to add to the findings. Counsel states takes no action on what the Court orders. Based on the report Court finds Defendant not competent, and to remain in, in patient care.
Clerks review - no appearance required scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 07:00 am.
No objections by parties to reschedule 8/17 return on report to 8/15.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No objections by parties to adjournment of return on doctor's report. Court orders competency evaluation to be completed inpatient.
Letter Wisconsin Forensic Unit Re: Evaluation Status - doc for review to Judge Cain
Absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

1:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Stephanie M Slavik as a friend of the court. Court reviews case history. Counsel advises Defendant is requesting an attorney but was unable to complete evaluation. Discussion held on bond. Court will appoint counsel pending evaluation of PD.

1:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephanie M Slavik not in court, in custody at the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Stephanie M Slavik as a friend of the Court. Defendant refuses to participate for today's hearing. Counsel raises competency. Statement by Corp Gahan. Court finds probable cause and orders competency evaluation.
Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
